taxonAuthor: Puckree-Padua, Haywood, P. W. Gabrielson & Maneveldt, 2021

texts.shortText: Spongites yendoi (misapplied previous name to what are now several species).

Moderately thick, encrusting and distinctly knobbly species usually associated with the gardening limpet Scutellastra cochlear although also spreads onto rocks away from limpets. Colour bright to dusky pink. Individuals do not fuse together and can be distinguished, but also do not form distinct ridges where they meet.

The taxonomy of this entity is complex and several closely-related species from this genus co-exist on the same shores The original name Spongites yendoi was applies to all of these and remains a valid species name, but for a species that occurs in Japan.
Colonies typically about 1 mm thick, but can spread over large areas of rock, with individuals indistinct.

Global: Endemic to South Africa

Local/Regional: Restricted distribution in SW Cape.
Forms extensive sheets in the mid to lower intertidal often associated with the gardening limpet Scutellastra cochlear, growing both on the backs of the limpets and on the rock between them.
Reproductive conceptacles form small low mounds with a central opening which maybe occluded by a circle of filaments.

One of three very similar knobbly and difficult to separate species in this genus. Location can assist in identification though, as C. capense only occurs over a restricted range in the SW Cape, whereas the very similar C. globosum and C. occidentale extend all the way up the west coast. See references below for details accounts of how to differentiate these species.

Branch, G, Griffiths, CL, Branch, M & Beckley, L (2016). Two Oceans: A Guide to the Marine Life of Southern Africa (Fourth edition). Struik Nature, Cape Town. (p. 418).

Puckree-Padua, CA, Gabrielson, PW & Maneveldt, GW (2021). DNA sequencing reveals three new species of Chamberlainium (Corallinales, Rhodophyta) from South Africa, all formerly passing under Spongites yendoi. Botanica Marina, 64(1), 19-40.

Puckree-Padua, CA, Gabrielson, PW & Maneveldt, GW (2022). Chamberlainium (Corallinales, Rhodophyta) in South Africa, an exemplar for the study of coralline algae, description of C. tenue sp. nov., biogeography of the genus, and species keys. South African Journal of Botany, 150, 178-193.

Puckree-Padua, CA, Haywood, A, Gabrielson, PW & Maneveldt, GW (2020). Reassignment of some South African species to Chamberlainium, with a comment about the recognition of families of Corallinales (Rhodophyta). Phycologia, 59(6), 464-496.
